title: Honda's Sales Are Horrible in November—Except For One SUV
description: American Honda concluded November with a disappointing performance in terms of sales volume. Compared to October, which saw a slight 0.5% month-over-month bump, the results for November show a steep decline: total sales slid to 102,824 units, down 16.8% from the previous month. The slowdown cut ...
titleSummary: "Honda Hits Rock Bottom Except for One High-Roller SUV Model"
descriptionSummary: American Honda's sales numbers took a sharp turn in November, plummeting by 16.8% to 102,824 units after a moderate 0.5% increase in October. This decline marked a significant slowdown for the company.

title: Bentley’s New Carbon Fiber Kit Brings Drama To Its Luxury Icons
description: Bentley has revealed a new Carbon Fiber Styling Specification for the Continental GT, GT Convertible (GTC), and Flying Spur sedan. For a brand more commonly associated with fine wood and sumptuous leather, it may come as a surprise to learn that a quarter of Bentley customers chose the previous ...
titleSummary: "Carbon Revolution Arrives at Bentley: A Dark Twist for Classic Icons"
descriptionSummary: Bentley is introducing a striking new Carbon Fiber Styling Specification for its Continental GT, GTC, and Flying Spur models. This bold option offers a modern contrast to traditional Bentley luxury trimmings.

title: Toyota's New Luxury Division Won't Follow Jaguar's Pure EV Direction
description: During the 2025 Japan Mobility Show, Toyota not only introduced a bold luxury coupe, but it also launched a new ultra-luxury marque that sits above Lexus. That brand is Century, and it could soon be Japan's answer to Rolls-Royce and Bentley. The Century Coupe looks like a good rival for the likes ...
titleSummary: Toyota's Upscale Brand Takes A Different Tack On Electric Vehicles
descriptionSummary: At the 2025 Japan Mobility Show, Toyota unveiled an ambitious luxury coupe and announced its new premium marque, Century, which eclipses Lexus in opulence. This ultra-luxury brand may soon dominate Japan's high-end market alongside Rolls-Royce and Bentley.

title: Someone Finally Stuffed a V10 Diesel Into a Ferrari F355
description: The mad geniuses at Grind Hard Plumbing Co are reviving a crashed and burned-out Ferrari F355 Spider with the engine swap you didn’t see coming. The team is currently working on dropping the 5.0-litre twin-turbo V10 diesel motor from a VolkswagenTouareg TDI into the lightweight Italian ...

descriptionSummary: Grind Hard Plumbing Co's eccentric engineers are breathing new life into a battered Ferrari F355 Spider by transplanting an unexpected powerplant: a mighty 5.0-liter twin-turbo diesel V10 from a heavy-hitting Volkswagen Touareg TDI.

title: Rimac One-Ups Musk By Revealing a Fleet of Robotaxis Before Tesla Does
description: For years, Tesla has been seen as the frontrunner in autonomous mobility. From Autopilot to self-driving cabs, the company is inching toward a future of driverless ride-sharing through gradual improvements in its driver-assist software. Elon Musk’s long-promised robotaxi network remains ...

descriptionSummary: Tesla's innovative approach to autonomous driving has been steadily gaining momentum since its introduction of Autopilot technology. The company continues to push forward with advanced driver-assist systems, bringing the prospect of self-driving ride-sharing closer to reality.

title: Trump Admin to Set New Fuel Economy Rules in Effort to Curb New Car Prices
description: According to new reports published on December 2 by Reuters and Bloomberg, sources close to the Trump White House told the outlets that the administration is prepared to introduce newly adjusted fuel economy standards as soon as Wednesday, December 3, in an effort to lower what it sees as a barrier ...
titleSummary: "White House to Revamp Auto Emissions Standards Amid Rising Vehicle Costs"
descriptionSummary: Sources familiar with the Trump administration's plans have indicated that new, revised fuel economy standards will be proposed as early as this week, aimed at easing what officials perceive as a significant regulatory hurdle.

title: Mercedes-Benz is Almost Ready to Introduce a New G-Class Cabriolet
description: Following the sharing of a shadowy teaser image in September, heralding the imminent introduction of a new G-Class Cabriolet, Mercedes-Benz has now released clear images of a prototype thereof, with the body still wrapped in camouflage. The trio of images was accompanied by a short spiel announcing ...
titleSummary: "Topless Luxury Arrives: Mercedes Prepares to Unveil G-Class Convertible"
descriptionSummary: Mercedes-Benz is gearing up to unveil its latest addition: a convertible version of the iconic G-Class. Following a cryptic teaser in September, the automaker has revealed clear photos of a camouflaged prototype, offering a first glimpse at the forthcoming model.

title: TEASED: Kia May Be Reviving the Stinger as a Sleek All-Electric Sedan
description: The Kia Stinger may be about to make a comeback as an all-electric sedan. The Stinger was foreshadowed by the 2011 GT Concept and the Kia GT4 Stinger Concept before finally entering production in 2017. With a front-engine rear- or all-wheel-drive setup and sharp styling, it drew comparisons to the ...
titleSummary: "Electric Stinger Revival in Sight: Kia Eyes Reboot of Its Performance Sedan Icon"
descriptionSummary: A revival of the Kia Stinger is rumored, this time as an electrified sedan, potentially building on the brand's previous concept cars that first hinted at its arrival nearly a decade ago with the 2011 GT Concept.

title: Downsized, Efficient, But Fragile — Why Today’s Engines May Not Last
description: There’s no escaping the fact that modern engines are failing at alarming rates. Toyota, Honda, and General Motors have all issued massive recalls involving hundreds of thousands of vehicles due to catastrophic engine failures. Engines are seizing up, catching fire, and leaving drivers stranded. ...

descriptionSummary: A disturbing trend is unfolding in the automotive world: a growing number of modern engines are succumbing to premature failure, prompting massive recalls from major manufacturers like Toyota, Honda, and General Motors.

title: Mazda Defends CX-5’s Giant Touchscreen After Fans Complain
description: Mazda unveiled the all-new CX-5 a few months ago, and one of the major talking points was its new user interface, now dominated by a large touchscreen. The move marked a departure from Mazda's traditional approach, sparking debate among enthusiasts who'd grown accustomed to the automaker's more subtle design ethos.

title: America’s Missing Out on the First Plug-In Nissan Frontier

title: The Cheapest ICE-Powered Dodge Charger Officially Goes On Sale

Initial reactions were lukewarm, but Dodge has since hinted at reviving traditional options for loyal followers.

title: Stellantis Is Backing Germany’s Call to Ease EU Emissions Rules
description: According to a new report published by Reuters on December 1, the large multinational automaker known as Stellantis is backing the German government's plea to soften the European Union car emissions rules that are set to take effect in about a decade, noting that the German Chancellor's proposal is ...
titleSummary: "Stellantis Throws Its Weight Behind Loosening EU's Stricter Emission Standards"
descriptionSummary: Stellantis, a leading international automaker, has come out in support of Germany's bid to ease EU car emission regulations slated for 2030. The move follows a proposal from the German Chancellor.

title: The New Alfa Romeo Quadrifoglios Are Instant Classics, But America Won’t Get Them
description: The most powerful versions of the Alfa Romeo Giulia and Stelvio almost reached the end of their production run. descriptionSummary: The final iterations of Alfa Romeo's potent Giulia and Stelvio variants narrowly escaped extinction before being given new life by a sudden change in direction from the brand, which is shifting focus towards electric vehicles.

description: The Tesla Robovan concept was unveiled at the company’s ‘We, Robot’ event in October last year to quite a positive reception. titleSummary: "Road to Autonomy: Electric RVs Steer Toward Revolutionary Road Trips"

title: 2026 Volkswagen ID.4 Faces Stiffer Competition Even as Prices Stay Flat

descriptionSummary: Volkswagen's Q3 2025 results reveal a significant boost for the ID.4, with sales skyrocketing 176% to 12,470 units year-over-year. Amid declining US market share, the ID.4 stands out as a rare bright spot in VW's lineup.

title: Your Next Family SUV Could Also be Your First Home Battery
description: The street is dark, your neighbors’ houses are out, and your kids are still watching Netflix like nothing happened. The difference is sitting in your driveway. Vehicle-to-home charging turns a Kia EV9 or Hyundai Ioniq 9 into a giant backup battery for your house, not just a way to skip gas ...

title: Kia Carnival, Sportage, and Seltos Set November Sales Records in America
description: Kia had another bumper sales month in November, with the Korean marque selling 72,002 vehicles in the United States. This is a 3% year-over-year increase and the brand’s best November ever. Kia also says the November result ensures it will achieve its third consecutive all-time annual sales record. ...

titleSummary: "Tesla Warning Issued by Renowned Analyst with Dim Outlook for Electric Car Maker"
descriptionSummary: Michael Burry's name has been etched into financial lore due to his prescient warnings about the 2008 crisis, immortalized in the hit film The Big Short. For those familiar with Wall Street, his story is a cautionary tale of foresight and hubris.

description: Which BMW 3 Series is the best 3 Series? You'll probably hear the second-generation E30 or the fourth-generation E46 as the top answers. descriptionSummary: The BMW 3 Series has a rich history, with several generations vying for the top spot. Two standouts are the sleek E30 and the iconic E46, both of which have earned cult followings over time.

description: Sedans have become scarce, particularly from American automakers, and at Ford, they're completely extinct. descriptionSummary: American sedans have all but vanished from the market, a casualty of the rise of utility vehicles. To make room for its new SUVs and crossovers, Ford's sedan lineup has been phased out, says CEO Jim Farley.

title: Toyota's New Supercar Will Share The Spotlight With A Lexus Twin
description: Only three days ago, Toyota teased its new sports car, which will be named GR GT. descriptionSummary: Toyota's highly anticipated GR GT is set to debut alongside two other siblings on December 5, following a brief preview earlier this week. A second teaser image has been released, fueling excitement for the upcoming sports car reveal.

It also paved the way for today's powerful Aston Martin GTs. The grand tourer’s rarity—just 1,022 models were built between 1963 and 1965—is another ...
titleSummary: "Revived Rarity: 1960s Aston Martin DB5 Transformed into a $1.3 Million Masterpiece"
descriptionSummary: The iconic Aston Martin DB5 has cemented its place in history with its impressive performance, sleek design, and memorable appearance in the James Bond film Goldfinger. Its influence can be seen in today's high-performance GTs. Only a limited production run of 1,022 models between 1963 and 1965 adds to its allure.

description: Before the Mustang GTD era swallowed most of Ford's performance attention, there was another factory-backed monster waiting in the wings. description: Automotive lawsuits cover a wide range of issues. They are usually filed for faulty products, missing features, or, worst, for vehicle occupant safety being put on the line. The latter is the most concerning, considering that a bulk of the value sold to a customer is the safety features and ...
titleSummary: "Ford's Faulty Fuel Cell Blamed for Fatal Crash in C-Max Hybrid"
descriptionSummary: Automotive lawsuits often stem from defects in design, manufacturing, or functionality. However, the most alarming cases involve compromised vehicle safety, which is a crucial factor in consumer purchasing decisions.

title: Why Florida Drivers Don’t Know They’re Breaking the Law

What used to be a harmless bit of personal ...

descriptionSummary: A recent change in Florida's traffic laws has flown under the radar for many motorists: since October 1st, drivers are being held accountable for two separate infractions that were previously overlooked.

title: $5 Million Lawsuit Alleges Toyota Ignored Transmission Problems for a Decade

titleSummary: "Class Action Suit Claims Toyota Knew of Faulty Gearbox Issues Since 2010"

Recent cases involve Honda facing lawsuits over steering problems, Ford dealing with claims related to a missing F-150 Lightning feature, and GM navigating allegations of faulty V8 engines.

descriptionSummary: Electric vehicles have long dominated acceleration and performance charts, leaving gas-powered cars in their dust. Witness the electrifying spectacle of Teslas and other EVs dismantling high-performance internal combustion engines on the drag strip.

title: The Only V8-Powered BMW M3 Is Now Budget-Car Cheap
